name: raptly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you watch or listen raptly, you give something your complete attention: The audience listened raptly. I'm reminded of those who sit in front of a TV, staring raptly at the screen.
More examplesFewer examplesThe volunteers sat at wooden tables, raptly taking notes.The 42,000 fans who filled the stadium stopped everything and watched raptly. About 120 people attended last night's meeting, listening raptly as officials presented the latest statistics.Such is the force of the conductor's authority that the musicians follow him raptly.
